end.title: The Prestige
end.creator_credit: Emma Thomas, Christopher Nolan and Aaron Ryder
end.brief_description: Hugh Jackman and Christian Bale star as a pair of duelling illusionists in this mind-bending period drama from visionary director Christopher Nolan.

links.description: Birds in cages appearing and disappearing is a recurring motif in The Prestige. Just like the illusionists of the 19th century, Christopher Nolan is fascinated by the power of images to fool, surprise, and delight us.

start.title: How Not To Be Seen
start.brief_description: “How Not to Be Seen” is a popular sketch from Monty Python’s Flying Circus. It first aired as the 11th episode of the second series of the show in 1970. The sketch purports to be a British public service film.

end.title: How Not To Be Seen
end.brief_description: A satirical take on instructional films, How Not to Be Seen features a mix of actual and virtual performers and scenes, which illustrate the strategies for becoming invisible, communicated in an authoritative narrative voiceover. - MoMA

links.description: As well as borrowing a title from Monty Python, Hito Steyerl’s dry and surreal humour pervades her rumination on the nature of image and privacy in the 21st Century.

start.title: The Prestige
start.creator_credit: Emma Thomas, Christopher Nolan and Aaron Ryder
start.brief_description: Hugh Jackman and Christian Bale star as a pair of duelling illusionists in this mind-bending period drama from visionary director Christopher Nolan.

end.title: The Invisible Man
end.brief_description: The Invisible Man is a 1933 American pre-Code science fiction horror film directed by James Whale. Based on H. G. Wells’ 1897 science fiction novel The Invisible Man and produced by Universal Pictures, the film stars Claude Rains, in his first American screen appearance, - WIKI

links.description: Making a person disappear is Hugh Jackman’s obsession in The Prestige, but it’s also the premise of pre-Code science-fiction hit The Invisible Man.

start.title: The Invisible Man
start.brief_description: The Invisible Man is a 1933 American pre-Code science fiction horror film directed by James Whale. Based on H. G. Wells’ 1897 science fiction novel The Invisible Man and produced by Universal Pictures, the film stars Claude Rains, in his first American screen appearance, - WIKI

end.title: How Not To Be Seen
end.brief_description: “How Not to Be Seen” is a popular sketch from Monty Python’s Flying Circus. It first aired as the 11th episode of the second series of the show in 1970. The sketch purports to be a British public service film.

links.description: There’s a fine line between fantasy and surrealism. Being invisible is treated sensitively in The Invisible Man, but in this Monty Python sketch leads to rampant explosions.

start.title: The Invisible Man
start.brief_description: The Invisible Man is a 1933 American pre-Code science fiction horror film directed by James Whale. Based on H. G. Wells’ 1897 science fiction novel The Invisible Man and produced by Universal Pictures, the film stars Claude Rains, in his first American screen appearance, - WIKI

end.title: The Unfinished Swan
end.brief_description: The Unfinished Swan is a game about exploring the unknown. The player is a young boy chasing after a swan who has wandered off into a surreal, unfinished kingdom.

links.description: The Invisible Man is wrapped in bandages to reveal his shape, just like the player covers an invisible world in paint to explore it in The Unfinished Swan.
